data.title: English
data.text:
When you think of Central American countries, you might expect their official language to be Spanish. Surprisingly enough, in Belize, the official language is... English ! 
 Other languages are also recognized (Kriol, Spanish, Garifuna, Maya...) but as Belize was a colony of the Crown until 1981, it has inherited its language. Since its independance, it has become a member of the Commonwealth.

data.title: Belmopan
data.text: The former capital of Belize, Belize City, is located on the coast and has been devastated by Hurricane Hattie in 1961 (half of the city was destroyed). Thus, in 1970, the government moved to Belmopan, a new-built city situated inland. The name of the city comes from the union of the Belize and the Mopan rivers.

data.title: The Great Blue Hole
data.text: The Great Blue Hole bears its name well. It is a marine hole located off the coast of Belize in the atoll of Lighthouse Reef. It is a circular hole of 124m deep. It is a popular spot for tourism and scuba diving.

data.title: Mixed culture
data.text: Belize is a unique place where several cultures met. As of its location, it has a mix of Central American (Maya, Garifuna) and Carribean (Creole) cultures but it also got influenced by Spanish and British cultures due to the colonization.

data.title: Coral reef
data.text: The Belize Coral Reef is part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef System which is the second largest coral reef system in the world after the Great Barrier Reef in Australia.
